literature.name: Sully Prudhomme
literature.achievement: in special recognition of his poetic composition, which gives evidence of lofty idealism, artistic perfection and a rare combination of the qualities of both heart and intellect

literature.name: Theodor Mommsen
literature.achievement: the greatest living master of the art of historical writing, with special reference to his monumental work, A history of Rome

literature.name: Bjørnstjerne Bjørnson
literature.achievement: as a tribute to his noble, magnificent and versatile poetry, which has always been distinguished by both the freshness of its inspiration and the rare purity of its spirit

literature.name: Frédéric Mistral
literature.achievement: in recognition of the fresh originality and true inspiration of his poetic production, which faithfully reflects the natural scenery and native spirit of his people, and, in addition, his significant work as a Provençal philologist

literature.name: José Echegaray
literature.achievement: in recognition of the numerous and brilliant compositions which, in an individual and original manner, have revived the great traditions of the Spanish drama

literature.name: Henryk Sienkiewicz
literature.achievement: because of his outstanding merits as an epic writer

literature.name: Giosuè Carducci
literature.achievement: not only in consideration of his deep learning and critical research, but above all as a tribute to the creative energy, freshness of style, and lyrical force which characterize his poetic masterpieces

literature.name: Rudyard Kipling
literature.achievement: in consideration of the power of observation, originality of imagination, virility of ideas and remarkable talent for narration which characterize the creations of this world-famous author

literature.name: Rudolf Eucken
literature.achievement: in recognition of his earnest search for truth, his penetrating power of thought, his wide range of vision, and the warmth and strength in presentation with which in his numerous works he has vindicated and developed an idealistic philosophy of life

literature.name: Selma Lagerlöf
literature.achievement: in appreciation of the lofty idealism, vivid imagination and spiritual perception that characterize her writings

literature.name: Paul Heyse
literature.achievement: as a tribute to the consummate artistry, permeated with idealism, which he has demonstrated during his long productive career as a lyric poet, dramatist, novelist and writer of world-renowned short stories

literature.name: Maurice Maeterlinck
literature.achievement: in appreciation of his many-sided literary activities, and especially of his dramatic works, which are distinguished by a wealth of imagination and by a poetic fancy, which reveals, sometimes in the guise of a fairy tale, a deep inspiration, while in a mysterious way they appeal to the readers' own feelings and stimulate their imaginations

literature.name: Gerhart Hauptmann
literature.achievement: primarily in recognition of his fruitful, varied and outstanding production in the realm of dramatic art
